name: Riparian Corridor Width/Quality
functionStatement: Organic matter is captured and broken down, fueling food webs, balancing production/ respiration, moderating pH/ redox, and supplying nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Sufficient native vegetation width unless historically narrow (e.g., prairie streams).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Buffer width via GIS + veg class field

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Cropland, pavement, or fill to the top of bank. Less than 5 m
Criteria: < 5 m or essentially no corridor

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Narrow grass strip or mowed edges. About 5-15 m
Criteria: 5-15 m and limited native diversity

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Mostly vegetated but interrupted by lawns or crossings. About 15-30 m
Criteria: 15-30 m with partial native cover

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Continuous native trees and shrubs on both banks at about 30 m or more
Criteria: Approximately >= 30 m native buffer. Diverse structure
